run.name: help
run.description: Show the help text and quit

run.name: version
run.description: Show the package version and quit

run.name: license
run.description: Show the license and quit

run.name: html
run.description: Use this flag to analyze .html files instead of standalone .js files. Turn on dom-resource-loading to load externally linked scripts/iframes/etc. If you know the url of the html you should set it with --url.

run.name: sym-exec-external-scripts
run.description: Use this flag to download and run externally linked scripts, when --html mode is being used with symbolic execution. Remember to enable --dom-resource-loading for loading of external scripts for the individual executions after symbolic execution.

run.name: no-summary
run.description: Turn off the summary of extracted information which runs after all analysis is finished.

run.name: no-summary-file-copying
run.description: Disables the copying of resources/snippets to the summary folder to save disk space.

run.name: all
run.description: Run all modes of analysis: default, multi-execution and symbolic-execution.

run.name: default
run.description: Run a default analysis: This runs the script under the default sandbox context, logging any interesting information found.

run.name: sym-exec
run.description: Run a symbolic execution analysis: This runs the script under dynamic symbolic execution to find different sandbox contexts which trigger different behaviours.

run.name: sym-exec-location-object
run.description: By default, symbolic execution tracks location as a string symbol "location.href". This option instead tracks location as a object (with .href, .protocol, etc) but disables correct tracking for when location is used like a string in the code.

run.name: no-sym-exec-dom
run.description: Disable symbolic tracking of DOM API values during symbolic execution mode (so there's only ActiveX symbols being tracked).

run.name: no-sym-exec-activex
run.description: Disable symbolic execution of ActiveX emulated objects when running symbolic execution mode which speeds up symbolic execution. (With this enabled, ActiveX uses their default properties.)

run.name: no-sym-exec-activex-buffers
run.description: Disable symbolically tracking ActiveX buffers such as XMLHTTP's response body or TextStream's buffer. (With this enabled, only non-buffer variables are symbolically tracked in ActiveX objects.)

run.name: no-sym-exec-rewrite
run.description: Disable rewriting of the input code before symbolic execution. This can help with javascript-obfuscator's self-defending code feature. However, this will mean that unimplemented APIs will cause crashes and reduce code coverage.

run.name: multi-exec
run.description: Run a multi-execution analysis: Cover all of the code by forcing execution of the multiple control paths. Since execution is out of order, there may be errors but potentially new information can be extracted.

run.name: no-multi-exec-loop
run.description: Do not modify loops so that their body statements are forced to execute in multi-execution mode.

run.name: multi-exec-loop-limit
run.description: Applies a rewrite to for, while, do while where the loop is limited to the number supplied to this flag.

run.name: multi-exec-function-limit
run.description: Applies a rewrite to functions that limits the number of function calls that can be done to the number supplied to this flag.

run.name: no-multi-exec-events
run.description: Do not force event execution in multi-execution mode.

run.name: no-multi-exec-function
run.description: Do not rewrite function declarations in multi-execution mode (run functions normally).

run.name: no-multi-exec-condexp
run.description: Do not rewrite conditonal expression statements (boolexp ? dothis() : nodothis();) in multi-execution.

run.name: multi-exec-only-eval
run.description: Only apply multi-execution rewriting to code passed into eval.

run.name: multi-exec-no-eval
run.description: Do not apply multi-execution rewriting to code passed into eval (only to global).

run.name: limit-dom-log-length
run.description: This limits the length of logged dom function arguments to be only around 30 characters. This makes the logs easier to read.

run.name: debug
run.description: Die when an emulation error occurs, even in "batch mode", and pass on the exit code.

run.name: loglevel
run.description: Logging level (debug, verbose, info, warning, error - default "info")

run.name: threads
run.description: When running in batch mode, how many analyses to run at the same time (0 = unlimited, default: as many as the number of CPU cores)

run.name: download
run.description: Enable downloading in the ActiveX emulation to actually download the payloads

run.name: dom-resource-loading
run.description: Enable resource loading (loading of externally linked iframes, images, stylesheets, scripts) in the DOM emulation

run.name: dom-network-apis
run.description: Enable XMLHttpRequest and fetch APIs in the DOM emulation so that network requests can be sent.

run.name: encoding
run.description: Encoding of the input sample (will be automatically detected by default)

run.name: timeout
run.description: The script will timeout after this many seconds (default 10)

run.name: output-dir
run.description: The location on disk to write the results files and folders to (defaults to the current directory)

run.name: preprocess
run.description: Preprocess the original source code (makes reverse engineering easier, but takes a few seconds)

run.name: unsafe-preprocess
run.description: More aggressive preprocessing. Often results in better code, but can break on some edge cases (eg. redefining prototypes)

run.name: prepended-code
run.description: Input file or directory containing code that should be prepended to the JS file(s) we're analyzing. If directory is given,  prepends contents of all files in the directory in

run.name: no-kill
run.description: Do not kill the application when runtime errors occur

run.name: no-echo
run.description: When the script prints data, do not print it to the console

run.name: no-rewrite
run.description: Do not rewrite the source code at all, other than for `@cc_on` support

run.name: no-catch-rewrite
run.description: Do not rewrite try..catch clauses to make the exception global-scoped

run.name: no-cc_on-rewrite
run.description: Do not rewrite `/*@cc_on <...>@*/` to `<...>`

run.name: no-eval-rewrite
run.description: Do not rewrite `eval` so that its argument is rewritten

run.name: no-file-exists
run.description: Return `false` for Scripting.FileSystemObject.FileExists(x)

run.name: no-folder-exists
run.description: Return `false` for Scripting.FileSystemObject.FileExists(x)

run.name: no-function-rewrite
run.description: Rewrite function calls in order to catch eval calls

run.name: no-rewrite-prototype
run.description: Do not rewrite expressions like `function A.prototype.B()` as `A.prototype.B = function()`

run.name: no-hoist-prototype
run.description: Do not hoist expressions like `function A.prototype.B()` (implied by no-rewrite-prototype)

run.name: no-shell-error
run.description: Do not throw a fake error when executing `WScriptShell.Run` (it throws a fake error by default to pretend that the distribution sites are down, so that the script will attempt to poll every site)

run.name: no-typeof-rewrite
run.description: Do not rewrite `typeof` (e.g. `typeof ActiveXObject`, which must return 'unknown' in the JScript standard and not 'object')

run.name: proxy
run.description: [experimental] Use the specified proxy for downloads. This is not relevant if the --download flag is not present.

run.name: url
run.description: Specify the document's url and referer attribute for emulation.

run.name: user-agent
run.description: Specify the user agent string to be used for navigator.userAgent and for the JSDOM resource loader.

run.name: windows-xp
run.description: Emulate Windows XP (influences the value of environment variables)

run.name: vm2
run.description: Analyzes the JavaScript in a vm2 virtual machine instance rather than the default jsdom. This means there is little to no DOM analysis but there is still activex analysis.

run.name: cookie
run.description: Pass in a string to set document.cookie to one initial cookie value.

run.name: cookie-file
run.description: Pass in a path to a file consisting of cookie strings separated by newlines to set multiple initial document.cookie values.

run.name: session-storage-file
run.description: Pass in a path to a file consisting of a json to set initial sessionStorage values.

run.name: local-storage-file
run.description: Pass in a path to a file consisting of a json to set initial localStorage values.

run.name: testing
run.description: Ignore. Used for when running tests with Mocha.

export.name: help
export.description: Show the help text and quit

export.name: version
export.description: Show the package version and quit

export.name: loglevel
export.description: Logging level (debug, verbose, info, warning, error - default "info")

export.name: cuckoo-address
export.description: Address of the Cuckoo API (format: host:port, eg. localhost:8000)

export.name: cuckoo-all-files
export.description: Submit all files written to disk to a Cuckoo sandbox

export.name: cuckoo-executables
export.description: Submit all executables written to disk to a Cuckoo sandbox. Has no effect when used with --cuckoo-all-files.

export.name: cuckoo-urls
export.description: Submit URLs to a Cuckoo sandbox

export.name: malwr-all-files
export.description: Submit all files written to disk to Malwr

export.name: malwr-executables
export.description: Submit all executables written to disk to Malwr. Has no effect when used with --malwr-all-files.

export.name: malwr-private
export.description: Mark Malwr samples as private (not to be shared with the community)

export.name: vt-all-files
export.description: Submit all files written to disk to VirusTotal

export.name: vt-executables
export.description: Submit all executables written to disk to VirusTotal. Has no effect when used with --vt-all-files.

export.name: vt-rate-limit
export.description: Rate limit (in requests per minute) against the VirusTotal API (default 4)
